unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Sees Increased Adoption**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Sees Increased Adoption**

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – October 26, 2023 – Indian manufacturers are increasingly turning to sophisticated inventory forecasting techniques to optimize supply chains ahead of the peak festive season, particularly in anticipation of Onam demand spikes in Kerala and Tamil Nadu. A recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) indicates a 20% rise in adoption of AI-powered forecasting tools compared to last year.

A recent report by the Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) indicates a twenty percent rise in adoption of A I-powered forecasting tools compared to last year.

unnormalised: "Accurate demand prediction is crucial, especially with raw material price fluctuations and transportation costs," says Dr. Lakshmi Iyer, Head of Supply Chain Management at IIT Madras. "We're seeing companies like Tata Steel and Reliance implementing advanced algorithms to predict demand for everything from steel pipes to petrochemicals."

unnormalised: Improved forecasting allows for better procurement planning, minimizing wastage and ensuring timely delivery.
